name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: As someone who is switching from another brand to Fujifilm, I have found this a massive learning curve. Not so much with the exposure triangle, although this is a little different than the way it worked in my last camera, nor with the actual use of this camera. But the number of settings that can be found in the menu can be, at times, overwhelming. I'm still trying to get my head around some of them, and I have come from a background of film before moving onto digital and now, at 75, I have moved into mirrorless.Do I like the camera? No, I don't..... I LOVE this little beast and would recommend it to anyone that is thinking of changing to mirrorless. The fact that it is, like the majority of Fujifilm cameras, APSC and not full frame may turn a few people off, but I don't see that as a negative. At 40mp you can still make an enlargement of 24-inch (61cm) X 36 (91cm) inches without any loss and, if you wish to push things a little further, then 40 (101cm) X 60 (152cm) isn't out of reach either. Do you need larger prints than that? I know that I don't.

name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: The X-T5 is a great upgrade with ibis built in. Nice and light. Many options and that fujifilm retro look.

name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: Very prompt delivery. Great service as usual from amazon.I have had a Fuji Film X100s for 10 years and loved it, so decided to upgade.  Only a couple of weeks  with X-T5 camera but so pleased. Less bulky than my full size DSLR Nikon, all the manual dials  and film simulation love of Fuijifilm.

name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: I find the X-T5 auto focus to be amazing on any subject now! Itâ€™s blazing fast. The 40MP sensor really shines with the Fujinon XF 16-80 f4 lens. And yes!! love the Fuji film simulations in the camera. Iâ€™m a very happy customer

name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: I come from Canon full frame mirrorless (EOS R) and found the transition to Fujifilm easy. The X-T5 is a very capable camera and delivers very good images. I like the customizability and manual control dials. The overall ergonomics are fine for a relatively small body like this. The film simulations and jpg recipes make this a perfect camera for quick results if you don't want to spend time developing raws. The autofocus and face detection is good but not as good even compared to my older Canon EOS R. It's close enough though to not be a problem. I am using mostly AF-C and face detection on with high success rates. I give it only four stars due to some initial software glitches which I never had with Canon and for the use of some plastic in a premium body like this. I have absolutely no regrets and can highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants a small body with maximum capabilities.

name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: Veramente una bella macchina. Passo da reflex full-frame e APS-C.Il mirino Ã¨ ottimamente illuminato e chiaro, una soddisfazione.Peccato il display non si possa ruotare completamente, magari la prossima versione...Il sistema di supporto per la messa a fuoco manuale Ã¨ ad a dir poco eccezionale. Contrariamente i sistemi classici a prisma o altri, con il sistema di supporto al MF cosante di evidenziare sul display la parte a fuoco. In questo modo Ã¨ possibile decidere esattamente cosa mettere a fuoco anche se questa non Ã¨ nella parte centrale del display e comunque senza riposizionare il punto di messa a fuoco.Ovviamente questa feature Ã¨ ottima per i videomaker...A mio parere, anche se non una entry level, su questa fascia di prezzo non ho trovato nulla di paragonabile.

De plus, en photographie de rue, dÃ©ployer l'Ã©cran sur le cÃ´tÃ© le rendait un peu trop visible. Enfin, les 26 mÃ©gapixels du X-T4 ne permettaient pas un recadrage important.En outre, j'ai rencontrÃ© des problÃ¨mes de fiabilitÃ© avec mon X-T4 : des messages d'erreur au dÃ©marrage m'ont contraint Ã  le renvoyer pour rÃ©paration, ce qui a entamÃ© ma confiance en cet appareil.En ce qui concerne le X-T5 :J'ai Ã©tÃ© un peu dÃ©Ã§u en le dÃ©ballant : il semblait moins qualitatif que le X-T4. Ce genre de dÃ©tail change tout : plus discret, plus facile Ã  cadrer, c'est un rÃ©el bonheur pour mon style de photographie. De plus, sa lÃ©gÃ¨retÃ© est notable, chaque gramme compte.L'autofocus s'est nettement amÃ©liorÃ©, devenant plus rapide que celui de mon X-T4. Les menus ont Ã©tÃ© revus de maniÃ¨re positive (pourquoi Fuji n'a-t-il pas mis Ã  jour le X-T4 ?!!). Notamment, les 7 rÃ©glages personnalisÃ©s : plus besoin d'occuper l'un des 7 prÃ©rÃ©glages pour conserver un rÃ©glage neutre. Dans le X-T5, il est dÃ©jÃ  inclus en plus des autres. De plus, il se souvient du dernier rÃ©glage utilisÃ© lorsque l'on quitte puis revient dans le menu. Ce sont de petits dÃ©tails, mais aprÃ¨s avoir critiquÃ© le X-T4 pour ses problÃ¨mes d'ergonomie, ils sont vraiment apprÃ©ciables.En somme, achetÃ© Ã  un prix trÃ¨s compÃ©titif (merci Amazon), je ne regrette absolument pas mon passage au X-T5.Bonnes photos !

La rÃ©solution de 26,1 mÃ©gapixels offre une grande prÃ©cision, ce qui me permet de capturer des photos exceptionnelles.Ce que j'apprÃ©cie particuliÃ¨rement chez cet appareil photo, c'est sa polyvalence. Il dispose d'un large Ã©ventail de fonctionnalitÃ©s et de rÃ©glages personnalisables, ce qui me permet d'explorer ma crÃ©ativitÃ© et d'ajuster les paramÃ¨tres selon mes besoins. De plus, la mise au point automatique est rapide et prÃ©cise, ce qui facilite la capture d'images nettes, mÃªme dans des conditions de faible luminositÃ©.L'ergonomie de l'appareil est Ã©galement trÃ¨s bien pensÃ©e. L'Ã©cran tactile est rÃ©actif et intuitif, facilitant la navigation dans les menus et l'ajustement des paramÃ¨tres.En ce qui concerne la durÃ©e de vie de la batterie, je suis agrÃ©ablement surpris. La batterie tient assez longtemps, me permettant de prendre de nombreuses photos avant de devoir la recharger.En rÃ©sumÃ©, l'appareil photo Fujifilm XT5 est un choix exceptionnel pour les amateurs de photographie qui recherchent une qualitÃ© d'image exceptionnelle, une polyvalence et une facilitÃ© d'utilisation. name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: I purchased this camera as an upgrade to my  other Fuji camera. I was attracted by the sensor ugrade with the increase to 40 megapixel, the new processor and the auto focus improvements. I have not been disappointed.I love the Fuji build with its retro look and having the major dial controls accessible on the top of the body and not having to sort through various electronic screen menus to make adjustments.  Being able to preset the controls without having to even turn it on.I'm still in the early days of owning this camera so I have not had the opportunity to use all of the features the camera has, or to make in depth comparrisons with the images taken by the Xt-5 and those from my other Fuji cameras.

name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: Fujifilm X-T5 is one of the best cameras for hobbyists. I like its retro design, physical control dials and film-like picture profiles. The range of X-mount lenses is the best you can get for any mirrorless system.

reviews: This really is a fantastic image producing beast.If your used to a XT-3 or 4 you might initially think the build is a little less solid.But believe me, Iâ€™ve watched the videos on Ytube and read the reviews. This thing belts out fantastic images, my older computer, it is still a windows 10 and Iâ€™ve tried it on two along with a upto date windows 11 and a MAC. They handles RAW files fine. Low light ISO is great, as well as my older XT-3. It really does bring those listed lens to life and works really well with the older batch.Itâ€™s smaller than my old XT-3, now my second body.If youâ€™ve been looking to update your XT-1/2/3 and not sure about the 4. This NO5 is really fantastic.However if your happy with your Fuji 3 or 4 and itâ€™s doing the job you want then I wouldnâ€™t rush out and buy the new XT-5 itâ€™s Good. But I donâ€™t think itâ€™s the very best they have made. The overall feel is a little, well plasticky.But what a sensor.

reviews: Zur Kamera selbst kann ich noch nicht viel sagen, auÃŸer dass sie den Erwartungen entspricht, dass sie schon mal viel kleiner als meine alte Spiegelreflex mit entsprechend groÃŸen Objektiven ist. Ich bekam die Kontaktdaten vom Fujifilm-Support und habe nach einer Mail innerhalb eines Tages das deutsche Handbuch kostenfrei zugeschickt bekommen.

reviews: Je ne suis pas convaincu de la robustesse de l'appareil, J'ai dÃ» commander deux appareils XT5 et aucun d'entre eux ne m'a vraiment rassurÃ©.La premiÃ¨re commande, l'Ã©cran n'Ã©tait pas fixÃ© correctement, il allait dans toutes les directions...La seconde commande, j'avais le couvercle de la batterie qui ne tenait pas correctement, ce qui peut entraÃ®ner des passages d'eau sous la pluie.La qualitÃ© de lâ€™image est trÃ¨s bien, mais 40mpixel en raw sans pouvoir changer dans lâ€™appareil câ€™est vraiment Ã©nervant, je me retrouve avec des fichiers de 80mb, pour le stockage et le traitement avec un NAS câ€™est une galÃ¨re Ã  importer.Plusieurs points aussi sur la qualitÃ© des molettes en plastiques qui bouge facilement.Bref je parle que de points nÃ©gatifs mais Ã§a reste un trÃ¨s bon appareil photo dans lâ€™ensemble. Mais trop de mauvaise surprise.

name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: This is a lovely little camera, jammed full of features including some class leading elements such as the 40 mp sensor, superb in-body image stabilisation and various subject detection modes which were impressive. It produces great jpegs too. High ISO performance is not so good; anything above 6400 being pretty unusable.  I sent the lens back because I could not get a lens that did justice to the sensor - I shoot birds so it has to be a long lens and I could not find a suitable candidate. The high sensor resolution is likely to show up imperfections in lenses that would look good at 20 mp. I gave only four stars to the autofocus because I never had a chance to really see what it could do with great glass - but picking out the eyes of birds was very impressive. The EVF was bright and clear with very little lag and easily customisable to provide all the information you want - except the actual ISO being used! There are lots of customisable buttons which, with the dials and command wheels make the camera easily controllable when not in Auto mode. Overall I gave it four stars because of the lack of suitable glass for what I want. If you like landscapes or portraits there are loads of choices - but why do you need 40 mp for that?
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 May 2023

name: Fujifilm X-T5 Mirrorless Digital Camera Body, Black
reviews: Fantastic camera and as usual excellent quality from Fuji. Loved it and arrived well on time.
